stanza.line: Being your slave what should I do but (a)tend(/a)
Upon the hours and times of your (b)desire(/b)
I have no precious time at all to (a)spend(/a)
Nor services to do till you (b)require(/b)
Nor dare I chide the world-without-end (c)hour(/c)
Whilst I (my sovereign) watch the clock for (d)you(/d)
Nor think the bitterness of absence (c)sour(/c)
When you have bid your servant once (d)adieu(/d)
Nor dare I question with my jealous (e)thought(/e)
Where you may be or your affairs (f)suppose(/f)
But like a sad slave stay and think of (e)nought(/e)
Save where you are how happy you make (f)those(/f)
So true a fool is love that in your (g)will(/g)
(Though you do any thing) he thinks no (g)ill(/g)
